Ernest Chiu and Frank Ross discuss the newest wound care treatment options on SIRIUS Doctor XM Satellite Radio. Topics covered include proper wound diagnosis, etiology of impaired wound healing, treatment options, scar prevention and management, stem cell research, and hyperbaric oxygen therapy. For the next scheduled broadcast time, please call us at 212-598-6500. Hyperbaric & Advanced Wound Healing Center | Helen L. and Martin S. Kimmel                                                                                                                                                           Helen L. and Martin S. Kimmel          Hyperbaric & Advanced Wound Healing Center                                                       Home   For Patients   About Us   Education & Research   News and Resources   Contact Us                 NYULMC Home   Careers   Make a Gift   News        Enter your keywords:                                           Home         Print   Email   - A + A                                                                                                                                                 Hyperbaric & Advanced Wound Healing Center            We are committed to making world class contributions that place safety, best practice, and ethical patient care at the forefront of an academic culture devoted to excellence in research and education.     Our mission is to heal chronic, non-healing wounds in a personal and caring environment that involves patients and their families at every level of care. Under our innovative, comprehensive, and compassionate care system, healing is not just an outcome, it’s the expectation. This philosophy that every wound can heal is the focus of care at every level – from our wound center to the operating room to our research laboratories. We are dedicated to all aspects of healing, particularly on establishing the highest standards for persons with wounds including those with diabetes, disabilities, and the elderly.                                  For Patients                        Conditions We Treat       What is a Chronic Wound?       Wound Healing Services       Hyperbaric Oxygen Treatment       Forms for Patients       Insurance Information      More           About Us                        Letter from the Medical Director       Physicians/Faculty       Wound Care Specialist s       Administration      More           Contact Us                        Important Numbers       Maps and Directions       Parking       Help Us Heal Wounds      More                                                                       New Services!           Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) is one of several advanced treatment modalities offered by The Helen L. and Martin S. Kimmel Hyperbaric and Advanced Wound Healing Center. HBOT allows for a ten-fold increase in the plasma oxygen concentration, thereby accelerating the wound healing process.                  Upcoming CME course           Wound Care 101: Strengthening your Outpatient Practice      MAY 1, 2015 Friday 8am-6pm     NYU Langone Medical Center     Target Audience: Primary Care Clinicians and Allied Health Professionals who seek practical solutions for managing difficult wounds     Course Description: The data on evidence-based wound treatment options are overwhelming. The one day course will focus on how to diagnose and treat common wound problems encountered daily by office-based practicing physicians, nurse practitioners, physician assistants, etc.     You can call 212-598-6500 for more information.                  NYU Surgeons discuss latest wound care advances          Drs. Ernest Chiu and Frank Ross discuss the newest wound care treatment options on SIRIUS Doctor XM Satellite Radio. Topics covered include proper wound diagnosis, etiology of impaired wound healing, treatment options, scar prevention and management, stem cell research, and hyperbaric oxygen therapy. For the next scheduled broadcast time, please call us at 212-598-6500.
